definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
variant of 嗑[ke4]
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head

sentences.english: Make Mo to also follow to generally bend down, kowtow.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨也跟着一般的跪下，磕头。

sentences.english: Let Luan school and GuanYa before the memorial tablet of LuanFu kowtow to apologize.
sentences.chinese: 让栾学堂和关雅丽在栾父的牌位前磕头认错。

sentences.english: Light also know that the sea king XuanZu meaning, so again kowtow.
sentences.chinese: 光海君也明白宣祖真意，所以再次磕头反对。

sentences.english: When they saw the monk, they fell on their knees and knocked their foreheads on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 当他们见到那个和尚时，马上跪下来磕头。

sentences.english: This type of batch processing shouts, "Get in line to genuflect."
sentences.chinese: 这种“整批处理”的含义是“排队磕头”。

sentences.english: The whole family is pleasantly surprised, kneels kowtows, this elephant is leisurely and carefree.
sentences.chinese: 全家人又惊又喜，跪地磕头，本象悠闲。

sentences.english: Nine pounds left kowtow to thank his care.
sentences.chinese: 九斤离开时磕头感谢四爷的照顾。

sentences.english: A building resident bows her head in grief for her relatives that were killed in the flames.
sentences.chinese: 一位大楼居民为死去的亲人磕头。

sentences.english: Hassan has a tremendous sense of dignity and refused to kowtow, so your government eventually sent him to prison and tortured him, he said.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑有巨大的尊严感，拒绝磕头。

sentences.english: They will give us new year money.
sentences.chinese: 磕头拜年，父母给压岁钱。

sentences.english: When life kowtows to you, you will bite it, even you know it's just lure.
sentences.chinese: 当生活向你磕头，即明知是诱饵，你也会咬住。

definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel down
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to kowtow/to kneel and worship
to bow with hands held in front
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to bow in salute/to kowtow
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to bump one's head/to kowtow with head-banging on the ground
to kowtow
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
